alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Inland; Clarke; Conecuh; Escambia; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 5:11PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Monroe, northwestern Baldwin, southeastern Clarke, western Escambia, southwestern Conecuh and northwestern Escambia Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 509 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a cluster of strong thunderstorms extending from near Frisco City to near Uriah to 4 miles north of Atmore, moving west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bay Minette, Atmore, Monroeville, Frisco City, Stockton, McCullough, Uriah, Excel, Bratt, I65 And CR 1, I65 And AL 113, I65 And AL 21, I65 And AL 225 and Poarch Creek Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin Inland; Clarke; Conecuh; Escambia; Monroe
